DOC.brief_summary: The impact breastfeed infant microbiome vaginally Cesarean deliver offspring obese normal weight mother .
DOC.detailed_description: Design : Normal weight ( NW ; pre-pregnant BMI < 25.0 kg/m2 ) , obese ( Ob ; pre-pregnant BMI > 30.0 kg/m2 ) , gestational diabetes ( GDM ) , Type 2 diabetes ( T2D ) , Type 1 diabetes mother 3rd trimester pregnancy follow -along respective offspring- first 12 month life recruit University Florida ( UF ) Health Shands Hospital . Stool , saliva blood , vaginal swab , placenta , urine , body composition clinical variable collect mother infant delivery , 2-weeks , 2-months , 1-year UF Clinical Research Center . The study team recruit equal sample pregnant mother follow group ( n=50 group ) : 1 ) NW vaginal delivery ; 2 ) NW C-section delivery ; 3 ) Ob vaginal delivery 4 ) Ob C-section delivery ; 5 ) GDM vaginal delivery ; 6 ) GDM C-section delivery ; 7 ) T2D vaginal delivery ; 8 ) T2D C-section delivery ; 9 ) T1D vaginal delivery ; 10 ) T1D C-section delivery . Infant body composition primary outcome monitor via anthropometry . Stool , saliva vaginal swab sample collect participant may use animal study whereby germ-free mouse inoculate stool sample evaluate causal role microbiome clinically relevant phenotype ( i.e . pediatric obesity ) .
DOC.criteria: Between age 18 45 year age . Prepregnancy BMI great 30 kg/m2 Prepregnancy BMI le 25 kg/m2 At risk gestational diabetes Pregnant Type 1 diabetes ( T1D ) Pregnant Type 2 diabetes ( T2D ) pregnant within 3rd trimester ( 3436 week gestation ) You plan deliver Greater Gainesville area Plan deliver via vaginal cesarean section Plan exclusively breastfed infant least 2 month Child receive pediatric care UFHealth Smoking Preeclampsia History preterm delivery ( < 35 week ) Only one breast capable lactation milk production inadequate Age < 18 yr , > 45 yr Any maternal antibiotic last 2 week delivery Any alcohol consumption Drug use
